class_notes: This seminar will survey major poets, schools and movements that make up American Poetry from the latter half of the 20th-Century to the present day.  Attention will be focused both on canonical authors and on emerging voices such as Ocean Vuong, Victoria Chang, Solmaz Sharif, Fatimah Asghar, Franny Choi, and Danez Smith. Topics in new social movements will include the Black Aesthetic, Native American Poetics, the Beat generation, Projective Verse, Feminist and LGBTQIA+ verse traditions. Requirements include online journaling and critical analysis essays.
course_description: Studies in poetry. Readings may focus on one or more authors or poetic traditions. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
